words.definition: An account is a description of an event.
words.example: The witness gave an account of the accident.

words.definition: An architect is a person who designs buildings.
words.example: The architect designed a new school for the city.

words.definition: To conceal something means to hide it.
words.example: The man tried to conceal his identity.

words.definition: A crime is an act that is against the law.
words.example: Stealing is a crime.

words.definition: A deed is an action that someone does.
words.example: The boy did a good deed by helping the old woman.

words.definition: Gratitude is a feeling of being thankful.
words.example: She expressed her gratitude for the gift.

words.definition: A habitat is the natural home of a plant or animal.
words.example: The ocean is the habitat of the whale.

words.definition: To intervene means to become involved in a situation.
words.example: The teacher intervened in the argument between the students.

words.definition: A landmark is a recognizable object or building.
words.example: The Statue of Liberty is a famous landmark in New York.

words.definition: If something is legal, it is allowed by the law.
words.example: It is legal to drive at the age of 18 in most countries.

words.definition: If something is memorable, it is worth remembering.
words.example: Our vacation was a memorable experience.

words.definition: To oblige someone means to force them to do something.
words.example: The law obliges people to pay taxes.

words.definition: An offence is an act that breaks the law.
words.example: Speeding is a common driving offence.

words.definition: To proclaim something means to announce it officially.
words.example: The king proclaimed that the war was over.

words.definition: A rally is a large public meeting.
words.example: People held a rally to support the new law.

words.definition: To resolve something means to find a solution to a problem.
words.example: The two sides resolved their dispute.

words.definition: A resource is something that can be used to help you.
words.example: The library is a great resource for information.

words.definition: A sentence is a punishment given by a judge.
words.example: The judge gave him a three-year sentence.

words.definition: A volunteer is someone who does work without being paid.
words.example: She works as a volunteer at the hospital.

words.definition: A witness is someone who sees an event happen.
words.example: The witness told the police what he had seen.
